title: Ticket #5438: [EC2]  Pre-sanitize logs.
description: FermiLab doesn't like to share their EC2 (GAHP? GridManager?) logs without sanitizing them first. We can almost certainly safely avoid writing the unclean data in the first place.
remarks:
2015-Dec-11 14:14:38 by tlmiller:
Obviously, if we're writing the keys to the log(s), that has to stop.

2015-Dec-11 14:28:31 by tlmiller:
Tony (and/or his security people) would prefer that the access key ID be omitted from the logs. (It shows up in the logs of the EC2 request bodies; as far as I know, only the secret key part is actually sensitive, but there's only going to harm in omitting it if the same user submits jobs with different accounts.)
